main event: A bright orange, circular object was observed moving erratically in the sky over Rockville, Maryland on June 12, 1954. It made several stops along its flight path during the 5-minute observation.
interesting points: The object was observed by a civilian and was reported to have no discernible size.
Observational data such as exact time, duration, altitude, and direction were not included in the report.
Radar scope observation at Washington National Tower was negative, and aircraft observation in the vicinity also yielded negative results.
The object's behavior was described as erratic, with maneuvers resembling that of a bouncing ball at times and stationary at other times.
The object was sighted for two hours between 21:24 and 23:23 EST by a civilian employed at Command Post USA.
